methodology.title: Methodology
methodology.heading: Our Methodology
methodology.subtitle: How we evaluate products across multiple sustainability dimensions to provide you with accurate, transparent, and actionable information.

overview.title: Our Approach to Product Evaluation
overview.paragraph1: At Ethix, we believe that making sustainable choices should be easy and accessible. Our methodology combines rigorous research, data analysis, and expert evaluation to provide you with a comprehensive understanding of a product's environmental and social impact.
overview.paragraph2: We evaluate products across multiple dimensions, considering the entire lifecycle from raw material extraction to end-of-life disposal. Our goal is to help you make informed choices that align with your values and contribute to a more sustainable future.

steps.title: Data Collection
steps.description: We gather information from multiple sources, including manufacturer disclosures, third-party certifications, lifecycle assessments, and independent research.

steps.title: Impact Assessment
steps.description: We evaluate products across 12 impact metrics covering environmental, social, and product-specific dimensions, customized by product category.

steps.title: Scoring & Benchmarking
steps.description: We rate products from A to F on each applicable metric and calculate a weighted average for the overall score, comparing against industry benchmarks.

steps.title: Review & Verification
steps.description: Our team of sustainability experts reviews each evaluation, verifying data accuracy and ensuring consistent application of our methodology.

rating_system.title: Our Rating System
rating_system.description: We use a letter-grade rating system (A-F) to make it easy to understand how products perform across different impact metrics.

excellent.label: Excellent
excellent.description: Industry-leading performance that goes above and beyond standards. Represents innovation and exceptional commitment to sustainability.

very_good.label: Very Good
very_good.description: Significantly better than average performance, exceeding standard requirements and demonstrating strong sustainability practices.

good.label: Good
good.description: Average to above-average performance that meets sustainability standards and demonstrates improvement efforts.

below_average.label: Below Average
below_average.description: Below average performance with significant areas for improvement. May comply with minimum requirements but lacks comprehensive sustainability efforts.

poor.label: Poor
poor.description: Poor performance that fails to meet minimum sustainability standards, or cases where companies have demonstrated negligence or greenwashing.

not_applicable.label: Not Applicable
not_applicable.description: Used when a specific metric does not apply to a particular product category, or when insufficient data is available for evaluation.

calculation.title: How We Calculate Overall Scores
calculation.paragraph1: Overall product scores are calculated using a weighted average of applicable metrics. The weighting varies by product category to reflect the most significant impact areas for each type of product.
calculation.paragraph2: For example, water usage is weighted more heavily for textile products, while energy efficiency receives greater emphasis for electronic devices. This category-specific approach ensures that products are evaluated fairly within their respective contexts.

improvement.title: Continuous Improvement
improvement.description: Our methodology is not static—we continuously refine our approach based on new research, evolving industry standards, and feedback from sustainability experts. We regularly review and update our ratings to reflect the latest information and best practices.

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.description: We believe in full transparency about our methodology. For each product evaluation, we provide detailed information about the data sources and criteria used. If we encounter data limitations or uncertainties, we clearly disclose these in our assessments.

impact_metrics.title: Our Impact Metrics
impact_metrics.description: We evaluate products across 12 impact metrics, organized into three main categories. Each metric is carefully defined with specific criteria and evaluation standards.
impact_metrics.explore_button: Explore Our Impact Metrics in Detail

environmental.title: Environmental Impact
environmental.description: We evaluate the complete environmental footprint of a product, from resource extraction and manufacturing to transportation, use, and end-of-life disposal.

metrics.name: Carbon Footprint
metrics.description: Measures greenhouse gas emissions throughout the product lifecycle, converted to CO2 equivalent (CO2e).
metrics.methodology: Data is gathered from lifecycle assessments, manufacturer disclosures, and industry benchmarks. We consider both direct emissions from production and indirect emissions from transportation and energy use.

metrics.name: Water Usage
metrics.description: Quantifies the total water consumption required for production, including water used in material extraction, manufacturing, and processing.
metrics.methodology: We analyze water consumption data across the supply chain, with particular attention to water-intensive materials and manufacturing processes. This includes water pollution impact as well as consumption.

metrics.name: Resource Efficiency
metrics.description: Evaluates how efficiently the product uses raw materials and the proportion of renewable or recycled materials.
metrics.methodology: We assess material composition, use of virgin vs. recycled materials, material yield during manufacturing, and design elements that minimize waste generation.

metrics.name: End of Life
metrics.description: Assesses how easily the product can be recycled, composted, or otherwise diverted from landfill after use.
metrics.methodology: We analyze product design for disassembly, material selection for recyclability, availability of take-back programs, and biodegradability where applicable.

social.title: Social Responsibility
social.description: We examine how products impact the people involved in their creation, from working conditions and fair wages to community impact and inclusivity.

metrics.name: Labor Practices
metrics.description: Evaluates working conditions, fair pay, safety standards, and worker rights throughout the supply chain.
metrics.methodology: We analyze third-party labor certifications, company policies, factory audits, living wage calculations, and reports from labor rights organizations.

metrics.name: Community Impact
metrics.description: Assesses how production affects local communities, including job creation, community investment, and avoiding displacement.
metrics.methodology: We examine company disclosures, community feedback, news reports, and NGO assessments about relationships with local communities.

metrics.name: Diversity & Inclusion
metrics.description: Examines company commitment to diversity, inclusion, and accessibility in both workforce and product design.
metrics.methodology: We analyze company diversity reports, leadership composition, inclusive design features, and policies supporting marginalized communities.

metrics.name: Human Rights
metrics.description: Evaluates compliance with human rights standards, including prevention of forced labor, child labor, and discrimination.
metrics.methodology: We incorporate data from human rights organizations, supply chain transparency disclosures, and third-party human rights audits.

governance.title: Corporate Governance
governance.description: We evaluate the business ethics and transparency of companies, including their commitment to sustainability, tax practices, and stakeholder engagement.

metrics.name: Transparency
metrics.description: Assesses how openly a company shares information about its supply chain, ingredient sourcing, environmental impact, and social practices.
metrics.methodology: We analyze the comprehensiveness of sustainability reports, supply chain disclosures, ingredient transparency, and responsiveness to stakeholder inquiries.

metrics.name: Ethical Business Practices
metrics.description: Evaluates company conduct regarding anti-corruption, marketing claims, lobbying activities, and tax responsibility.
metrics.methodology: We incorporate data on legal compliance, ethical controversies, third-party ethics certifications, and alignment between public statements and actions.

metrics.name: Sustainable Commitment
metrics.description: Measures long-term commitment to sustainability through policies, targets, investments, and executive accountability.
metrics.methodology: We evaluate science-based targets, sustainability roadmaps, capital allocation to sustainable initiatives, and executive compensation tied to sustainability goals.

lifecycle.title: Life Cycle Assessments
lifecycle.description: Comprehensive evaluations of environmental impacts throughout a product's life cycle.

academic.title: Academic Research
academic.description: Peer-reviewed studies and publications from academic institutions and research organizations.

investigations.title: Independent Investigations
investigations.description: Findings from NGOs, investigative journalists, and independent monitoring organizations.

benchmarks.title: Industry Benchmarks
benchmarks.description: Data on industry averages and best practices for different product categories.

team.title: Meet Our Methodology Team
team.description: Our methodology is developed and maintained by a diverse team of experts with backgrounds in sustainability science, environmental engineering, social responsibility, and product design.

items.question: How often do you update your ratings?
items.answer: We review and update our ratings regularly as new information becomes available. Major updates to product evaluations are conducted at least annually, while our methodology undergoes continuous refinement based on the latest research and industry developments.

items.question: How do you handle products with limited information?
items.answer: When information is limited, we clearly indicate data gaps and may assign a lower rating if transparency is a concern. We reach out to manufacturers for additional information and update our evaluations as more data becomes available.

items.question: Do you consider price in your ratings?
items.answer: Our primary focus is on sustainability performance, not price. However, we do provide price information to help consumers make informed decisions. We believe sustainable options should be accessible to all, so we feature products at various price points.

items.question: How do you prevent greenwashing in your evaluations?
items.answer: We look beyond marketing claims and require substantive evidence of sustainability practices. Our methodology prioritizes third-party verification, quantifiable metrics, and transparent reporting. Companies must demonstrate real impact, not just good intentions.

items.question: Can companies pay to improve their ratings?
items.answer: Absolutely not. Our ratings are completely independent and cannot be influenced by financial considerations. We do not accept payment from companies to improve their ratings or to be featured on our platform.
